snippet: For the second weekend in a row, "Dr. Seuss' The Lorax" was North America's No. 1 movie. It took in an estimated $39.1 million for a new total of about $122 million, according to Hollywood.com.
abstract: For the second weekend in a row, "Dr. Seuss' The Lorax" was North America's No. 1 movie. It took in an estimated $39.1 million for a new total of about $122 million, according to Hollywood.com.
lead_paragraph: A fuzzy orange cartoon character humiliated Eddie Murphy and one of Pixar's top directors at the weekend movie box office. For the second weekend in a row, "Dr. Seuss' The Lorax" (Universal Pictures) -- featuring that fuzzy character and the voice of Danny DeVito -- was North America's No. 1 movie. It took in an estimated $39.1 million for a new total of about $122 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box office data.

headline.main: 'The Lorax' Stays on Top at the Box Office
